intro: Weinmannia lechleriana, commonly known as the Lechler's weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
